question: When was the first ‘International Day of Epidemic Preparedness’ observed by UN?
explanation:
The first ever International Day of Epidemic Preparedness was held on 27 December 2020. It was called for by the United Nations General Assembly to highlight the importance of the prevention, preparedness and partnership against epidemics.
The WHO also published 10 ways that will help the countries to track and prepare for global health emergencies in the next year.
